hackathon-description-text: HackRice is Rice University's annual hackathon event. Participants trade their sleep for a weekend and join a team to create a project - typically software - in an environment optimized for creativity. At the end of the event, the participants demonstrate their projects to fellow hackers, visitors, and a panel of judges. The event is hosted by the Rice Computer Science Club.
hackathon-eligibility: Confirmed HackRice 6 attendees may make a Devpost submission. Submissions should be one per project. Alumni may also submit a submission, but it will not be eligible for judging and prizes.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Acer Chromebook 14 for each member of the winning team
GoPRO HERO Session for each member of the winning team
Amazon Echo for each member of the winning team
LG Electronics UM57 25UM57 25-Inch LED-lit Monitor for each member of the winning team
Fitbit Charge 2 for each member of the winning team
Best use of IoT platform on Bluemix receives Apple Watches
Find meaningful user groupings (segmentations) from any large dataset and use the groupings to provide better user recommendations.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: PROS: Segmentation and Big Data Challenge

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best project in data science.  This may involve aggregating or munging diverse data sets, machine learning, or an awesome data visualization application.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Two Sigma: Best Data Science Project

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best use of AWS receives Dell 1TB Hard Drives
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: MLH: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best domain name registered with Domain.com receives Domain.com swag bags
Best hack against online harassment receives Hack Harassment swag bags
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: MLH: Hack Harassment - Best Hack Against Online Harassment

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best device privacy hack receives Watch Dogs 2 Collectors Edition Game
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Have you seen a project like this before? How innovative is the solution?
How technically impressive is the project?
Does this project have important implications? Would this project be used outside the hackathon?
How refined is the idea, UI, and overall presentation?
